jira.description: Jira Service Management MCP server for ticket operations. Provides tools for creating, reading, updating, and querying JSM tickets. Set the environment variables above before use.

notes.setup: 1. Set JIRA_INSTANCE_URL to your Atlassian instance (e.g., https://your-org.atlassian.net). 2. Generate an API token at https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens. 3. Set JIRA_AUTH_TOKEN to the generated token. 4. Set JIRA_USER_EMAIL to the email associated with the API token. 5. Set JIRA_PROJECT_KEY to your IT support project key.
notes.level_1_permissions: At Autonomy Level 1, only jira_get_issue and jira_search_issues should be allowed. All write operations (create, update, comment, transition) require human execution.
notes.level_2_permissions: At Autonomy Level 2, add jira_create_issue (P3/P4 only), jira_add_comment, and jira_update_issue. P1/P2 creation still requires approval.
notes.level_3_permissions: At Autonomy Level 3, all tools are available. jira_transition_issue enabled for closing tickets after verification.
notes.level_4_permissions: At Autonomy Level 4, all tools fully autonomous.
